Authors: Bernhard Hausdorf, Frank Walther, Marco T. Neiber
Title:
Molecular phylogeny and systematics of Acrotoma (Gastropoda:
Clausiliidae) from the Caucasus
Keywords:
Acrotoma, biogeography, Caucasus, Clausiliidae,
distribution, Georgia, phylogeny, Russia, taxonomy
Abstract:
The land snail genus Acrotoma (Clausiliidae) from the
western Greater Caucasus is revised and a molecular phylogenetic
analysis of the genus is presented. Shells and, as far as known,
genitalia of thirteen species are described and figured. Two species are
described as new to science, i.e., A. vespa n. sp. and A. enguriensis
n. sp. The diagnostic characteristics are summarized in a table. All
locality records are listed and shown in distribution maps. Based on
Bayesian, Maximum Likelihood and Maximum Parsimony analyses of
mitochondrial and nuclear DNA sequences we revise the classification of
the genus and suggest a division into three subgenera, Iliamneme,
Acrotomina and Acrotoma s.str. The radiation of the Acrotoma species in
the Pliocene and Quaternary might have been triggered by the orogenesis
of the Greater Caucasus, which created habitats, like canyons and alpine
environments, to which the Acrotoma species adapted.
